description:
Sometimes I come here because it's close to my house. I either get the Iced White Mocha/Caramel Macchiato with a total of 3 shots. Delicious!
Last week, however, I realized it's doesn't close at 9 every night. I think I can still charge my iPhone wirelessly on the Powermat!

Homeless people like to stay outside, waiting for money. I'd rather given them food and make their day. I am a generous man, and sometimes I feel like helping beggars. That's how you make America Great Again!
author: Julio B.

description:
They are frequently understaffed during the morning rush hour with on average 2-3 workers total with always only one person making the drinks (the other at cashier and the other if there is one on food). Hence, orders take longer than promised to come out even if you placed them via mobile order. The flow of the place seems off and inflexible - staff should float around and assist with not only food but drinks too if the drinks are getting backed up.  

The morning staff frequently don't correctly customize my drink per the order instructions. The amount of espresso shots was off once, too. Ice customization is never considered, not even once.

Customer service is also super lacking if not borderline abrasive and cold. I love Starbucks as a company but this store is definitely the worst coffee shop that I have ever been to and needs to make some extreme improvements.
author: Amanda N.

description:
This review is specifically for Jason who is working today, Sep 8th at 10:25 am. I ordered a Almond Blended Cold Brew and the 3-4 customers after me received their drinks before me. I went to check on my drink and he replied along the lines of 'it's going to take a minute because there's a lot of steps'.... so I asked for a refund and as I was asking for a refund he said to the other employees 'hers was next but she didn't want to wait'
 
Yes, I didn't want to wait any longer because it was getting ridiculous. Just because a drink has a lot of steps you don't prioritize it? Makes absolutely no sense... and not to mention your snarky tone.

If the reasoning was valid and customer service was better I wouldn't of been upset.
author: Ella C.

description:
Rude barista...sure, whatever. But...

This Starbucks REMOVED all of its power outlets, so the whole reason for me coming in (to check my email and book a hotel) was not possible. All that parking hell just to have my time wasted.

What an obnoxious purposeful inconvenience for its customers.
author: Kaleb S.

description:
Hey. It's Starbucks.

What the hell do you want?

Overrated, Overpriced.

Homeless guy at the front entrance, opening the door for you.
Homeless lady outside staring at you from outside.
Homeless lady with huge, unleashed dog.

Sketchy neighborhood. 
Hipster Douchebags.
author: Ron Z.

description: Staff seems nice to each other as they are consistently talking with other staff members. Sometimes about work but usually not. Super slow service even when there are few customers. Use to be a good place but not any more.
author: gary l.

description:
Starbucks isn't my favorite. I normally love a good local cafe. But I go to Starbucks regularly because they are usually dependable for consistency, cleanliness, fast service and basic connectivity including power. 

This Starbucks failed in all fronts. 

They only had two people working at rush hour in the am (not the employees fault, they did their best). So service was slow. It wasn't particularly clean (bathroom was disgusting). The latter was undrinkable. But most annoyingly, they went out of their way to cover up any and all power plugs. 

Not cool Starbucks!!
author: Shannon L.

description:
Literally the worst Starbucks store I have dealt with in my entire life. The staff is incredibly unprofessional, lazy, and forgetful. And this is not from a first time visit. This store has become my new Starbucks stop, as I just moved to the Sunset Area. Every single visit I've made to this store (about 10 total) I've have at least one item from my order either forgotten about or just straight up missing. It's extremely frustrating, as I'm trying to catch a quick bite/drink before I start work but my order is incomplete!! Every. Single. Freaking. Visit I've made this far, an item would go missing/forgotten about, so I'm left there waiting for it, until I finally freaking ask. It's SO GODDAMN ANNOYING. HOW DO YOU GUYS END UP FUCKING UP MY ORDER ON EVERY SINGLE VISIT????? 
Anyway, I started ordering online to save time in store and guess what?????? THE SAME THING HAPPENS!!!!!! Third time doing an online order and third time I'm left there to wait for my food that I already placed 20 minutes prior. You guys seriously need to step up your customer service game because it's basura my dudes. 
This goes to the entire 1-2pm staff except the tallish dude with longish hair who wears a beanie (looks like a skater). He's always super nice to me and seems to be the only person who genuinely cares about my order. Whoever you are, KEEP KILLIN IT!

It probably won't make a difference to their business but today was definitely the last straw. Won't be coming back so GOOOODBYE STAR-SUCKS
author: Tina D.

description:
Drinks here are like at any other Starbucks chain. Yeah, it's not the best quality, but it's cheap and conveniently located. Place is pretty large, and nice to hangout. Also the place to go whenever youre hanging out in the area and need to use the restroom haha. 

I like he hibiscus berry tea cause I'm not much of a coffee drinker, but man that tea is good.
author: Edmund L.

description: Work Starbucks  ever! Writing this review as I eat my refrigerator tasting bagel and sip my rewarmed green tea latte! So disappointed AGAIN! Keep giving this place chances with no luck! GET IT TOGETHER!
author: Gina P.

description:
Starbucks, a "third space" (you know, not work, not home, but a solid hangout). Not a single outlet to plug in a phone or computer.

Great thinking, Starbucks.
author: david p.

description:
Other than the homeless occupying the counter facing Irving and the crackheads that usually camp out front (bathrooms/free water) this Starbuck's offers the perfect caffeinated release for those looking for that quick jump of energy.

The staff here are pretty darn quick with taking orders and the line of people (most of them are tourists looking to use the bathroom) but since these are locked down, get in line and pay for that privilege!  At the least, it keeps the restrooms clean and not filthy.  Second, forget finding a seat in the midmornings-afternoons.  The tables are usually taken up by the local seniors who order a tall coffee then sit there for 3-5 hours chattering loudly, stopping long enough to go outside and smoke their pollutants outside, then come back in to continue their sitting session,

On the plus side, their hot drinks and black iced teas are always on point and good.  In addition, I've sampled some of their breads, such as the iced lemon pound cake and when in season, their pumpkin loaf is my fave!

Great location on the corner of 19th and Irving, but good luck finding parking.  Because you never will out front.
author: Miika M.

description:
I don't stop at this Starbucks often, but when I do I often end up wishing I was at another one. These folks just aren't that we'll organized. I often wait longer than it seems reasonable, at least compared to other SBs I have frequented.

 In addition, where are the smiles? I have been to much more friendly locations.

Lastly, is it so difficult to keep the chocolate powder at least partially filled?!
author: Ben T.

description:
Spoiled soy milk was in my drink. I should have known when the girl with glasses taking my order gave me a bad attitude acting like she didn't like her job and the barista who self handingly handed me the drink with a fake smile telling me to "enjoy" as the Asian barista, right before making my drink, went to the cashier whispering to her then proceeding to make my drink after a two minute convo, probably discussing if they should use the expired soy milk or not. 

This took place on December 21st at 5:15pm. Maybe the both girls were upset I was using a birthday reward. Sorry, but if I'm spending $5,000+ on the company that you're working for, a $5 drink that your company is giving to me for free isn't going to hurt you. 

Took one sip and it tasted like a sour mess. WonFeeling really sick the night before my birthday, no thank you! Won't take any chances at any other Starbucks.
author: Grace H.

description:
Wow. It's a good thing I had a giftcard because this specific Starbucks needs better customer service by far. I came in around 6:20am and waited about 10 minutes for 10 pastries. About 5 mins after paying for the pastries, a woman came up to me and said they were out of the specific pastries I ordered and I would have to pick different ones. Ok, fine; that would have been nice to know prior to pay nearly $25 for these. Then after waiting 5 minutes more, I was finally handed the pastries and the staff that bagged these said, "did you buy a bag?" and I said no, because when I'm buying pastries at the crack of dawn I do not think of buying a bag. Perhaps, it would have been helpful if your cashier asked if I wanted to buy a bag just like EVERY OTHER establishment in the bay area. So after my response, he said "well next time you have to buy a bag. I gave this one to you for free". Great, he stuffed 10 pastries into literally a GIFT BAG. Not even a regular size bag, and he stuffed the pastries into individuals baggies. Cool, I never asked for that, but perhaps if you wanted to save your business some money you could have 1.) asked me if I wanted to purchase a bag & 2.) ask if I wanted these pastries packed a different way
Dude, you gave me a "free bag" after you ran out of 4 pastries these I purchased? To note, I just told this lady to give me an assortment of the other 4 pastries- I didn't care to figure out if the pricing was different.

Though there were at least 5 staff members behind the counter, this didn't make service any faster nor any friendlier.

I can't come back to this Starbucks anymore because it's not very kind to ask if someone purchased a bag and that tell them that you gave them a free GIFT SIZE bag after stuffing $25 worth of pastries in it.

If you're not as awake as you should be,  neither is the customer who is at your coffee shop!
author: Tracy L.

description: I've never been more disappointed with a starbucks. I live close by and go here frequently. The staff is full of rude snotty employees who will back talk you and get annoyed if you ask for them to remake their drinks. I was just there a couple weeks ago nobody in line when I learned the drink I ordered wasn't in season. As I was thinking of what else to get the employee was extremely rude to me trying to get me to order other drinks in a sassy tone and finally gave up with me and said FINE DO YOU WANT WATER THEN?! I was so appalled by this behavior. I used to work at starbucks I understand things can be difficult but taking out your anger and frustrations on customers is not ok. On top of that I typically order the same drink a green ice tea with no sweetener and every time at this starbucks they take shortcuts fill the drink will green tea and put ice don't even shake it. There's a cup with line showing how much water and how much tea to put in and where to fill. The employees are not only rude but lazy. I don't recommend coming here.
author: Sophia L.

description: Slow motion serving. Atendente was not in control of his work. Wait time to long for a tall latte.
author: André O.

description: I can't believe this happened in Starbucks, they offer customers decayed food! I was trying to tell employees inside, but they were busy about their conversation. Not come back this store anymore.
author: Leng L.

description: This location has no outlets and they play their music way too loud. I can't even study here because it's hard to hear my own thoughts.
author: Saylor C.

description:
This is my neighborhood Starbucks and I'm a regular here. Everyone is really nice and patient with my small children and the bathrooms are clean. When you order in person they generally get your drink right and are very helpful. 

The reason I'm giving it four stars, though, is because they consistently screw up mobile iced coffee orders. My husband always orders a venti iced coffee with milk. The app clearly says there are 6 pumps of sweetener in this drink but they never sweeten it. Every single time I have to taste and then ask for sweetener. We've had friends pick up coffee for us as well with the same problem. 

When you ask for sweetener they seem annoyed and say the label doesn't say to sweeten it but the recipe in the app clearly says to sweeten! I talked to my sister who works at a different Starbucks and she confirmed that it should be sweetened. She ordered it from her app and went to pick it up from this store and same issue. I just wish they'd follow the iced coffee recipe because it's simple and is a real daily hassle.
author: Elisabeth S.

description: Starbucks is the best coffee shop in the world. I love how they are always so clean. This particular location is always prompt plus constantly providing a friendly service with smiles for days.
author: Gordians K.

description:
I went in around 7:30 tonigjt and the guy behind the counter wasrude and sullen. I said hi-he just stared at me. I orderedmy drink and asked for extramocha sauce on top of my Smoresfrap. He rang me up and handedme mychange without a word.  Hemade my drink and handed it to me, and inoticed there wasno mocha, so iasked very nicely for him to add it. "Oh thats what you want", hemumbled, and took my drink and added the mocha. I said tha k you-no reply,hejust turned away.   I went to get a straw, and there were no tall ones, so i asked "hey, do you have a tall straw?" I was given ablank look and he silently handed me a straw. I saidthanks-got no answer. Once in the car and drinking itj realizedhe'd put regular whip and not the marshmallow one. Not ahuve deal, buf id still like tobe told theres no more marshmallow, so i can decide if i want it without that ingredient or not.

All in all a really unpleasant experience.
author: Mer L.

description: Recently returned to SF to chill out at this previously reliable spot. Not the best coffee, but you should expect a nice space with all the usual Starbucks/coffeeshop amenities. This place missed all the marks. The staff were rude and rushed, not cheery and personable like you'd expect at a Starbucks. I bought a drink so I could sit down and work. Turns out that there are no power outlets! So I went over to the 19th Avenue location, and again, no outlets. I sensed that there was an overwhelming attitude of "give me your money and get out".  Overall, the environment seemed sort of hostile and I had a very unwelcoming experience. I will not be going here again!
author: Michael L.

description: We are regular customers who live around the corner. We have slowly stopped visiting as much due to diminishing quality of service. Today I was denied a cup of water and was told I'd have to buy one. I'm already hesitant to support big corporate establishments over mom and pop places. You lost us as a regular customer, Starbucks
author: Chip M.

description: I would give the store a negative stars if i could, I came here around 4 Pm today, waiting in line to get a drinks. The cashier was rude and constantly correcting me, but still got my drink wrong. While waiting for my drink A "coffee master" named IAN was making my drink was also rude. He steep the black iced tea for 2 minutes and poured in my cup without putting ice and water in the pitcher first (which was hot when poured into my plastic iced cup).Then proceeded to not shake my tea or measure correctly. Handed my drink with bad attitude and went back to make his other drinks without measurement or anything for anyone.
author: Kyden M.

description: The costumer service was not good, the manager Donnie told me that I couldn't use the restroom because I didn't buy anything when they were the one who didn't have change for a hundred. I felt like this was really rude after already having him be rude about me trying to pay with a 100$ bill. Donnie you should have been nicer.
author: Isabella J.

description: Employee that wears crop tops to work... my friend specifically asked for soy milk and when my friend asked if it was soy she responded "You didn't say that"... very rude. Could've said it in a better manner. Horrible customer service.
author: Samantha N.

description: I stopped by to use the restroom at this Starbucks, as I have done many times at other Starbucks', but was told I couldn't be given the code unless I made a purchase. Although I reminded them I had purchased coffee from another Starbucks earlier that day - making me a Starbucks customer, they insisted I had to make a purchase before being given the code. I've never came across such a policy. I understand why San Francisco might have a more strict policy, but the management I came across was very poor.
author: Bayram E.

description: This is my favorite Starbucks. The team there is awesome. Yes, I actually said awesome. The Manager sets the pleasant pace for the crew. She is always smiling, always remembers my name and makes my visit personalized; they never make me feel like I'm a bother or just a name they have to ask for to put on a cup. They put you in the right mood to tackle the day. I'm still learning all their names but Megan, the manager, Casey, Jack, and the one very tall barista for DC have always welcomed me with a bright smile and a quick conversation. Another plus. They always spell my name right. I may have said a lot and I am not been paid for this but I've been to other locations and the staff have been slightly rude, short with me, and just unfriendly and have gotten attitudes when I say small instead of using the Starbucks lingo. Megan's store on 19th is the total opposite and I love stopping in there. :)
author: Asia L.

description: Totally understand that it's SF and why they'd have strict rules about restroom use. But I'm also pretty sure they wouldn't have been pleased if I peed all over the floor because I couldn't hold it to wait in line to get the restroom code. I'd normally buy a drink and tip them generously but didn't when I received some major attitude by everyone in there.
author: Jane C.

description:
Pros - Convenient location
Cons - Unsafe. Every time I come here there are drug addicts camped out. They are also right outside on the sidewalk. I've seen them smoke meth/crack and then come into the cafe. Can be distracting - for instance one of them continuously mutters strings of obscenities and looks over his shoulder for hours on end and will slam and kick the long table everyone is sharing. Also just some rude people here. One customer was vaping by the front door (and leaning on it so it stayed open) and smoke was billowing into the front part  of the interior of the cafe. Staff is understandably unable/unwilling to address these issues.

This cafe is probably a great place to go if you're interested in buying some meth.
author: Matthew P.

description: Worst Starbucks I ever been to! The coffee is bitter, my son bring the coffee back in to ask them to remake it, they completely ignored him! They won't even remake or response him! What kind of customer service is that?  Unbelievable
author: Yuki L.

description:
Its a Starbucks first of all so there really isn't any originality. My review is of this location and not of the brand overall. 

Undergone renovations and has a modern and simple ambiance. Great place for hanging out or studying though the internt here is horribly slow! I can't dl/upload documents or content on the cloud without a long wait. Don't understand how the store owner can not invest in a faster internet plan. Come on everybody uses it! 

Coffee, pastries, and food is meh. Franchise food nothing exciting.
author: Jude N.

description: Use to be good place to grab a cup of coffee. There have new batch of employee and the quality went down hill.
author: Kobe J.

description: Very busy and somewhat understaffed. Coffee seems weaker than usual. Should be more professional with how corporate the feel is. Very cold but disorganized.
author: Colin L.

description:
I usually came here a lot because I lived their service!
But I hate to go there right now because of their store manager!!!!!!!!!
She does not have any customer service skill at all!!

I felt I was taking to a boss with her instead of ordering a drink.  There is no smile on her face, and she looks hella mean!!!

I got a wrong oder from her, and she insisted she was as right!!  And said I am the store manager!!

Sooooo what!!!!
author: Xena P.

description:
I was here today@3pm. The staff is so rude to the customers. While I was waiting in a short
line, I observed the two males and one female working the counter reply to clients with either
rude or snarky remarks, then look at one another and smile!! I went to use the bathroom, and I
have been in gas station bathrooms cleaner then this one. Paper towels all over the floor,no
toilet liners,toilet paper, over flowing trash can etc. When I reported it to the people at the
counter, they all looked at each other and just smiled. Never acknowledged my comment
about the restroom. I agree with all the other comments about the staff at this location.
author: Peter F.

description:
I don't understand such the poor reviews here BUT I do kinda come during down time. I guess ppl that review here are actually waiting in their long lines during rush hour.
Place has been renovated. It's clean. Staffs friendly enough. If you don't have time to wait for coffee just grab a drip and go! Duh.
author: Liz N.

description: Over the last few months I have noticed a change in the taste of my whole milk latte. A very metal like after taste. At first I thought it was an error in the milk used. I have gone back multiple times and have found the same taste regardless of barista. Other starbucks in the city do not have the same issue. I have voice my concern and have gotten no interest in investigating. My guess is either the milk frothing container needs replacing or the machine does. In either case I have thrown away my last 5 dollar latte.
author: Cynthia D.

description: Sloppy, rude... claims they cant break a $100 for a $30 purchase when the place is wall to wall filled with people all purchasing $5 coffees. Britt was particularly rude, short and unhelpful. I just remembered why I avoid corporate coffee establishments like Starbucks.
author: Halley M.

description: Good place to drop by for coffee and breakfast brunch lunch and if you feel like dinner.
author: Anthony V.

description: Service and drinks were great, maybe they are stepping up their game. I was a table hog and no one said anything (there was other tables open). Cool locations in the hustle and bustle.
author: Drew P.

description: Good location and staff but the place is bombard with homeless people loitering and make the place dirty.
author: Yong C.

description: Neighborhood Star right on the corner of a busy intersection. Accessible but difficult to find parking. Usual Starbucks menu so nothing new. This place does get crowded so seating can be a premium. Enjoy the coffee.
author: David H.

description:
I LOVE 19th Ave Starbucks cos I live so close by, and it is next door to Sunset Nails! I come in all the time, morning coffees before jumping on the train or bus, Afternoon Tea as well... or when I just need a Coffee or Iced Tea fix as well. They offer free wifi & the coded bathrooms keep the public out which is often nice. 

I love Starbucks during Autumn - Pumpkin Spice Latte time, & then during the Holiday Season I also love the Gingerbread Latte! Anything with Spice!

Lynette is my absolute favourite Barista, I know I'm going to get a perfectly crafted coffee when she makes it. She is warm, talented, savvy and sparkling; and the floor looks perfect when she manages it! I love approaching the Till when she is there in the mornings!

All of the Baristas for the most part are friendly, bubbly, & knowledgable. There is more of a MALE boyish presence to this Starbucks than the OTHER Starbucks on 9th & Irving which is more Feminine (sometimes I need to be around the Ladies) which has a very different feel in itself...

But all in all I defenitely think 19th Ave Starbucks is higher up in the ranks. When I walk in to Stores I have expectations & 19th meets them.
author: Julian I.

description: Just hope they can control the crazy people a little bit. Coffee is nice! Nice stuff
author: Sheila Q.

description: Walked in, waited in line and proceeded to order our drinks but they didn't have change for a hundred and we didn't have our cards with us...we had asked when we waked in to use the bathroom and the STORE MANAGER DONNIE said very rudely "restrooms are for customers only" we were with a group of my family basically everyone besides us were able to use the bathroom because they didn't have change for a hundred dollar bill. After I told the guy just to cancel the order because we didn't have any other way to pay, the store manager Donnie, butted in and said very rudely once again "you still can't use the bathroom" knowing my family bought drinks. And i said something to him and he was very rude. Has no sense of customer service. Can't believe that Starbucks allowed him to be the store manager. Never have I ever had an experience like that with any Starbucks location. Starbucks, you could do way better. Very disappointed. It was not our fault that we were not able to buy something, they didn't not have change for our bill and he still said we can't use the bathroom knowing we were going to buy something. And knowing my family had also bought drinks.
author: Esperanza J.

description: The staff is great here. I look forward to coming here each morning to help me start my day.
author: Kenny M.

description: Staff was a bunch of kids that averaged age 17. My drink wasn't made properly but not even mad about that. Looks like the manager forgot to order stock since most of their menu was sold out. Environment sucks.
author: Aaron C.

description:
OK, I know you are asking, how can a Starbucks get a five star?  After all, Starbucks is Starbucks right?  Well, maybe.  The coffee and food are about the same as any other Starbucks.

That said, I go across town (well, not far across town) to seek this one out.  Three main reasons:

The service is fast.  I always get in and out.
The people who work there are very friendly.
Most important, the lay out is really nice.  They have some nice seating at up tables.  When I go by myself (which I usually do) I sit at the "bar" which looks out the window, where you can watch people walk by on Irving and 19th Avenue.
author: Gary A.

description: Really disappointing. I pre-ordered a coffee traveler to pick up at 745am it when I arrived at 750 it wasn't ready and I was told to wait for 5 minutes. After about 5 minutes I checked in and they had obviously forgotten about me. Then I was told to wait in a long line to pay. What's the point of pre-ordering? Not coming back here.
author: Sandy A.

description:
My bro-in-law and I were grabbing an early coffee at Starbucks before a haircut down the street. I've been to a lot of Starbucks' and this is one of the only ones without seating outside.

I ordered a hazelnut latte but they were out of hazelnut! Instead I got toffee nut but found it overly sweet and not something I'd order again.

The service was apologetic but how can they be out of hazelnut first thing in the morning? There's limited seating all by the door so it can be pretty chilly. It's a very convenient location though so I will probably be back before you know it.

Food: 6/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description: Annabelle, the lady with the glasses, is rude. Not belong to these happy people who work there.
author: Calvin Nicholei L.

description: The floor looks like nobody has cleaned it since yesterday, and it's not like the place is especially busy. Not impressed.
author: Trish B.

description:
If you call in to reserve anything, make sure that someone actually picks up the phone to take your order. I left a message about my order (with time/date, contact info etc) after calling them five times because no one picked up the phone, and was later told that no reservation/order was made. 

Don't buy into that "friendly" recorded message saying that they are going to take your message. They will not.
author: Travis C.

description: Thanks Zoe for the ice water. Adol why do u just passed me up and ignore me. You just give free drinks to ur friends while letting ur customers wait wait wait
author: Kaycie N.

description:
Busy Busy BUSSSY!!!!

Dont come here unless you have an hour to spare waiting in line with the typical "SF crowd" which consists of drug addicts,meth heads, raunchy girls, homeless people that live in golden gate park, the ultra sweaty road cyclist, studious students, and stuck up guppy people. 

Did i miss anyone else?

The staff is friendly but it's just overcrowded and parking sucks.
author: Annette F.

description: The staff is nice but they have a big problem here - the place is packed, no seats, and the vast majority clearly aren't customers. They just hang out for some reason. They need to crack down on this.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I don't even want to give it a star. The baristas here are so rude. Just because my friend ordered an item from the secret menu, they gave us this attitude about it. Hey, i know baristas hate making drinks from the secret menu but you don't need to give us an attitude. SO RUDE. 
That's not even all, they made my friend say how to make it. Hey, if she had to do that, we can make it ourselves. I feel ashamed. I work at starbucks myself but i can't take it when they give it an attitude like that. ALSO, the barista with long blond hair and glasses "accidentally"  spilled a frap ON my friend. THAT IS SO RUDE. I don't even know what to say. BAD service.... PLEASE IMPROVE YOUR SERVICE
author: Emily H.

description:
This is one of my regular Starbucks I tend to go to. They are quick with their drinks and it's consistent each time. Staff is friendly even during their busy hours. 

This Starbucks is pretty clean overall. They have tons of space and tables for students to study. If you come in the mornings like me, you will not see as many students but more retirees where they are enjoying their cup of coffee with a newspaper. 

The only reason why this Starbucks is not 5 stars is the parking. If you're trying to come to this Starbucks once all the business around here opens, you will definitely have a hard time.
author: Stephen W.

description: This is my go-to coffee place whenever I am in the area.  Parking is all street parking, so definitely it can be a pain when trying to get here.  It is mostly all meter parking!  This place can be super busy and jammed pack in the morning, so don't come here if you are in a rush.  Drinks are pretty good here and the staff are usually very friendly.  No complaints from me here!
author: Teresa W.

description:
cashiers/staff: 5/5
drinks/food: 3/5 regular starbucks faire, not great but not bad either

This Starbucks has a pretty good amount of seating and service. The baristas make your drinks well and I haven't had any problems yet. The workers there are all very nice. Great for to go because they are fast.

However, don't come here if you want a quiet place to chill out or do your work in the AM or weekend. This Starbucks is extremely loud and most of the seating is taken up. Every single morning, there are groups of middle aged and older asian people who use this as their hang out spot (or reading newspapers spot) instead of going to the usual bakery or doughnut shop. Has any of you ever been to a chinese restaurant? Thats how loud it is in there and thats how it sounds. Sometimes they take chairs from other tables and try to cram 7-10 people around one seating area. Also, you get the rush from the parents who drop their kids off at the nearby schools. Sometimes its Cee Lai central (asian middle aged house wife). There are the occasional hobo or two and people with their laptops actually trying to do work in the noise. This is more like a community center than a starbucks.

Surprisingly, the place is still pretty clean for all the people who come through here. I've only come here once where they forgot to replace the condiments after the morning rush.
author: Cecile S.

description: They need to update their posted hours of operation. I wasted 15 minutes parking only to be told they were closed. We Yelp they were to be own another hour
author: John H.

description:
Cool points are being awarded righttttt... NOW. Always clean, inviting, and spacious, my neighborhood Starbucks is defo up there in great Starbucks locations. Drinks are accurately (and deliciously) made and staff are super friendly and always willing to help. The line can be kinda ridiculously long sometimes, so avoid peak hours.

Big shoutout to Mike, who went out of his way (on a busy morning at 9am peak hour) to go into their back inventory room to rummage through all of their holiday merch to find me not one, but TWO of the holiday mugs I've been looking for since the mugs were released. Give the guy a raise or holiday bonus!

Thanks 1800 Irving Starbucks. Me love you long time.
author: Mike N.

description:
Wanted to use the restroom first before buying coffee but this one girl told me to buy some first... I really had to use the restroom and had explained it to her but no... 

Btw the code is 2313
author: April S.

description: Always fast, baristas here are always friendly too. My go to starbucks in the city.  Don't think I've waited longer then three minutes for a drink, even during a rush.
author: Sophia M.

description:
Hey everyone,

I worked at this store and had a fantastic time.  I got hired when I was at the ripe ol age of 16 and left after two years to go to school.  I fell in love with all the locals and loved knowing someone's order right when they walked in the door.

I met a lot of cool people working here and the baristas here are doing the best they can.  I mean, can you imagine being cramped back there and having to make over 20-somthing drinks.

This was a great community store.

5 points for all the local customers.  I still remember your oder!

I understand many of your negative reviews but I swear we did try our hardest.

I am so happy to have been part of this company. 

Didi I mention the regulars freakin' rocked! You know who your are. :)
author: Julia Q.

description: So the strawberry yogurt muffins are slamming!!! Lovely staff, always clean, and you can charge your phone here without being hastled to move like other locations in the city. One day I was enjoying a muffin and all of a sudden a women walks in huffing and puffing about the delivery truck blocking her way out. Now anybody who's been on irving especially 19th avenue and irving knows there is hardly anywhere to park since tons of traffic in the area so spaces are limited. She's screaming in his face and threatening to call the police. Lol the truck driver just stood there not even phased by a screaming soccer mom in his face because he had a delivery to make. My point is double parking is going to happen so be prepared to be boxed in. Beat Starbucks in the city .
author: Tj J.

description: The Service is Amazing and the Workers are amazing and and the Latte's I get are Done Perfectly and it's Convenient.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Service is just OK, the place seems to only refill the sugar and creamers twice a day since it is always almost empty. The restroom isn't always clean.

For drivers this place is bad because people double park to get their coffee here and this shop is right at the corner.
author: M C.

description: Starbucks is everywhere in San Francisco, and coffee is everywhere in San Francisco. There's a lot of independent cafes. This Starbucks is right on the corner of 19th and Irving. I have gone there a few times. I like frappucinos. It's in a nice location, but I don't like Starbucks for the most part. I'd have to call it "Starsucks"!
author: Denise C.

description:
Typical Starbucks.

just very convenient for me since i live nearby.
author: Carol Y.

description: I love all the people that work here, they know me by name (which is probably due to my addiction to coffee) but I like to pretend it's because we are all friends haha, always super fast even when there is a huge line. love you guys!
author: B G.

description: I often seem to stop here for coffee while driving through the city up and down 19th. It's convenient and usually pretty friendly. There are plenty of places to sit and plug in, so there are usually quite a few people sitting with their laptops.
author: Steve B.

description: I don't normally come to this location, but decided to give it a go this weekend. Ordered an iced latte.. it had too much milk in it.. I wish I added a shot or asked for less milk.. Immediate regret.. I don't think I'll be returning any time soon.
author: Leslie C.

description:
I came here at like 5am and right as I go in there's already a line?! 

DAMN...Ah well..

THE DRINK:
 --  Mocha, extra hot, no whip, less foam, and an extra shop of espresso. 
Not bad. The girl looked groggy but she made my drink right; no complaints.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Great location, nice staff and clean tables.
author: Kristy F.

description: I went in the for the first time in months the service polite and very fast to get my order. But the only thing I didn't like is that these nasty looking Flys were all over the counter in the front and the back counters. It didn't seem to pleasant to get my drink and warm sandwich on these counters.. they need to cleanup the place and deal with the nasty pregnant fly problem
author: Juan F.

description: Sb was drugged outside and creeped me out from the window. Nobody from the store took care of it even when he walked in making creepy moves. I would never go back to this place again.
author: Lana J.

description: It's ok, but not that great. Convenient if your in the area but would not recommend otherwise. It gets very busy with people coming and going. Usually easy to find a seat if your by yourself, but not quite as much if your with someone else. The staff is just ok. Nothing great, or exemplary about them. The shades are always drawn all the way on all the windows too, which makes it very dark inside. It is also worth mentioning that I got a very stern warning one time about getting a refill. Watch out! :)
author: L. A.

description: The staff here is great smiles all around. I go to the city a few times a month and always stop in to get some coffee. I have waited out side the door the line was so long but went by pretty fast. This stores location has a lot to do with that next to a busy street and muni. The tables always seem to be full with students so I normally don't stay but it's nice to walk to the park and people watch.
author: Sean G.

description:
Coffee is always great, wifi is usually working well, but sometimes gets slow. 

Disappointed to find out they don't serve Irish coffee even on St. Patricks day.
author: Ben K.

description:
This location is usually the easiest to get to for me to/from work. I've stopped here about 3 times already and every time, parking is fairly easy...available on the same block. Although there is usually a line, it's no more than a 3 minute wait.

Staff are friendly and always upbeat regardless of the time. Large seating area, and fairly clean.
author: Alyssa G.

description: I went in and got my self a cup of drink and Madeline for my daughter. As they called my name and let me know the drink is ready. My daughter happened to want a cup of water. So I asked the brewer for a cup of water while I was picking up my drink. She told me that I have to wait awhile because she need to make lots of drinks. Well, I'm thinking I'm ahead of all these drinks and how hard is it for you to give us a cup of water!?
author: Jaylene L.

description: Always run out of breakfast sandwiches. Always packed. Shady characters hang around. Mediocre service
author: Don H.

description:
I will never go to this Starbucks again. Yesterday, I gave the clerk $20 to load my starbuck's card, the clerk refused to give me a receipt for it & stupidly trusted him. The next day I went in at my usual time, 8:30am and used the card which the clerk "supposedly" loaded the day before. To my surprise, they told me the card was empty. 

They were not helpful in helping me solve this issue and just said very flippantly "too bad", then pointed to the 800 on the back of the card and said to call the number but w/out a receipt I was shit out of luck. I am unemployed and to me $20 is a lot of money. Since obviously there is no one to help sort this out, I just have to accept that the clerk pocketed my money and there is nothing I can do.
author: Kelly I.

description: Never ever ever been to a Starbucks that announces when they're closing and kicks you out soon as they do. NEVER EVER. Thank you for something new, Irving & 19th Starbucks.
author: Kasey T.

description:
I like the young twenty-somethings who work in this branch, so it is with some reluctance that I have to relate a nagging problem that should have been rectified by now. 

Several months ago, I reported an electrical outlet in the shop that needed repair. I told a Barista who said word would be passed on to the Store Manager. About two to three weeks later, I spoke with the Manager to inquire about the repair, but was told  they hadn't heard about it. Okay, these things happen. I was told a service tag would be written, and upon checking back later that week, I was told it WAS written. It's been at least a month now, and the outlet has still not been repaired, so for this particular issue, the store gets a poor evaluation.   

On my last visit to the branch, the outlet was not working, the internet was down and the coffee wasn't hot enough. That was not a good experience at the branch, but I am glad to report that 98% of the time the experience here for me is just fine. I suggest a sign be posted at the register, or entrance door, to alert customers on those occasions when the internet is not working. 

This is a very busy branch that is otherwise okay, with friendly staffers who do their best. Please fix the outlet and consider my suggestion regarding the internet when it is down. Thank you.
author: Michael J.

description:
During my senior year of High school I would be here every morning for a coffee or vanilla latte because it's on the way to school.

The low star rating is because of the numerous times my vanilla latte came out tasting like non fat milk diluted with water.. (HOW?!). 

Granted, I have received some good drinks also, but the lack of drink quality consistency is ridiculous. .
author: Kennie D.

description: Good service,  no hassles.   My husband went for coffee this morning and said the servers are polite and friendly.  He got a refill and had no hassles whatsoever.  Did you know Stonestown Starbucks would INSIST on a receipt even asking if I remembered who I bought the first cup from.  OMG.  Talk about BS.  Anyway love the one on 19th Avenue.  I've been there several times.  Apparently lots of other love them too since they are very popular and doing good business.
author: Jane S.

description:
5 stars for starbucks? I mean c'mon right? It's just starbucks...

This review is not based off their coffee (although, I was introduced to the mighty Coffee Mistro the evening I attended) but rather my dining experience whilst at Starbucks.

It was one of those nights (ah ah ahhh) when everything (yes, everything) that could go wrong; was going wrong.

Got an email from the teacher stating the paper that was supposed to be attached - and due the previous week- was not attached to the email. My lap top is in the shop (virus); my neighbor was nice enough to let me use theirs - however, their mac would turn off within 10 minutes if not directly plugged into the wall. 

The paper, which was only on this lap top's desktop, could not be transferred via bluetooth and my iphone *shrugs.*  The jump drive with the paper already on it is mia. We try to piggy back off neighbors WiFi but alas, we kept picking up wireless networks except for the two nice neighbors who gave us their passwords. Now we have to lug the computer around (not my mac, mind you) until we find a hotspot - ALAS - Starbucks!

It was 9:30 - 30 minutes to closing. I place my order - plug in the lap top...only to find the outlet not working. Of course. Try a couple different ones - success. Get the lap top up and running and try to find the free Starbucks WiFi...only.....once AGAIN the computer was finding other networks but not the one I needed.

I asked the nice gentleman who had recommended the mistro (as it's the strongest they got) if he could help me with the WiFi settings - he told me the name and although we found it - the computer kept timing out and would not connect!

In comes another employee who has a mac. He tries to work some mac magic (me and other fella were familiar with PCs), he goes to settings; some network places, some other stuff.......and still...although it would find the at&t network the stupid thing would not connect!!! ARGHHH!!!! He said it was probably due to battery issues (Yuppp!)

The fellow suggested we use the store's lap top. My other half departs to Walgreens to pick up another jump drive so we can transfer the paper to the store lap top...By this time it was nearing 10 p.m.  they were sweeping and clearly closing but assured me I was 'ok' and could stay until we figured this out (they are students as well and recognize the importance of sending an over due paper.) 

My other half returns and in comes the store lap top. Naturally, the store lap top could not connect to the WiFi either. Also, the jump drive was not showing up on the mac. (ARGKHJHEDJWHSDJHASDKJAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!, right?)

At this point the store is closed, we are all equally frustrated and ready to throw the lap tops off the table.

I gave the mac to the mac friendly fellow and took the PC. After some toying I noticed the little blue wireless thingy was not on - switch it on. Mac dude noticed that the jump drive was one of those microchip cellphone jump drives - which we luckily happen to have within our phone. Insert, delete some shit (since it was full) and on goes the paper.

In goes the paper to the store's lap top, in goes the paper into the email and out goes the email.

I am totallllllllllllllllllllllllllly greatful they were all so willing to help us in our plight!! Without their help that night would have been even more miserable than it was! 

Thank you both (sorry I never got your names :( ) for helping us!!!!!!!
author: Maple S.

description: Not a whole lot to say really, essentially just another run-of-the-mill branches without Clover brews.  Staff are definitely nice and there's a decent amount of seating for work/study.
author: Eric F.

description:
Another study night at Starbucks 19th and Irving and it was nothing more of less than perfect, except that I only had an hour or so to study.  

Too bad that this store doesn't close at 10 or 11 or 12? lol  

The ambiance was great, jazz playing in the background and if you log into iTunes, you'll see the starbucks logo with the song that's playing at the time (thought that was pretty nifty).

my double tall, 1 pump WM, 2 pump hazelnut, soy @ 120 no whip or foam was made just perfect and I got to get a lot done.  

The kids that work here are pretty nice, but around 8:50ish everyone disappeared to the back, thought that was a lil weird, anyhow, stay open later please?
author: Edrian D.

description:
Yes, the couch cushions need to be fixed. That bugs me. Its also not up to the people behind the counter.

Most of the time (80-90%) the people behind the counter are GREAT at this Starbucks. They remember you, what you order and exactly how you want it. I rarely have to ask for bathroom code cause they know me and they know that I'll need the new one, so they just tell me.

Their biggest fault is sometimes the bar is a mess, however I've realized that they can barely see it from where they are standing. If I tell them at the the bar is out of milk or dirty, or the bathroom needs toilet paper, someone RUSHES out from behind the counter to fix it. 

Sometimes the homeless people and the crazies are annoying, but we live in SF and that's not Starbucks fault. 

I walk 6 blocks out of my way sometimes to get Starbucks here rather than the one that's on my way to work. The drinks might be the same, but the people aren't. And I like these people.
author: Chris G.

description:
BF & sis got caramel frap, it was GOOD.

Me & bro got mocha frap, it wasn't mocha frap. It was not chocolate-y at all. chocolate + coffee = mocha, it wasn't mocha. It was just coffee frap, so bro went back to ask for caramel frap instead, it wasn't like the one sis & bf got...it was tasteless, so bro & I added lots of powder & sugar, then it was decent.
author: Kylie L.

description: Just picked up my traveler and Jake gave me a discount!! Your awesome. Love my local Starbucks! Clay rocks the place. Always sweet.
author: Judy A.

description:
Coffee was as it should be, service was a little off given they were too busy carrying on their own conversation behind the counter.
It may be my accent, maybe im not speaking loud enough, but they never get my name right.
Not bad starbucks, but could do better =/
author: Genni V.

description: Found a parking space on busy 19th Ave and was looking frwd to a Starbucks latte. My exp was ruined by an immature cashier who was obviously talking about me (pointing finger at me/whispering) while I was waiting for my coffee. All I can say is ur stuck behind a counter on a fabulous sunny Saturday and I'm out enjoying the weather and my Starbucks latte... HAH! Don't think I'm coming back to this location; so many other locations with much better customer service...mature employees who are friendly towards their customers.
author: Alice C.

description: Seems to be a whole new crew from before... I heard sad stories about the team before... But I really like this group of ppl!
author: Genesis V.

description:
Friendly staff.  

But the wifi is absolutely horrible.  Slow with frequent drops.

If you go to Starbucks, you're going because you just need the basics.  They aren't getting it right.
author: Patrick C.

description: Not the cleanest Starbucks I've been into (or maybe it's the dim lighting?), but they have a pretty clean bathroom and the coffee was fine. If you are ordering a drip coffee and have a few extra minutes, they will brew it fresh for you, which I thought was awesome service! However, this isn't a location that you'd be tempted to hang out at. If you're looking to just pick up coffee, I would definitely recommend this Starbucks if you can find parking!
author: Amy D.

description: good location if you just happen to walk by...I like that they redid the table settings. Before it was impossible to get a spot to sit down with a laptop, now that they went with straight table settings, there are more spaces or spots for you to sit down at. the only grip I have is with the wifi. it is extremely slow. don't count on streaming video or music...
author: Myron K.

description: Crazy crowded on a weekday and they need plugs along the couch area. I got my free birthday drink today, decided to splurge on calories and got the cookies frap, it's not that good and it started separating real fast, look at my photo, gross!
author: Karen T.

description:
The code for the Woman's bathroom is: 1152.

Oh yeah, the iced tall Berry Tazo chai tea was good too. Quick service.
author: Janice C.

description: They make the BEST hazelnut macchiatos.  I know it's a new drink and some starbucks seem to make it too "thin" and with not enough foam.  But it was made perfectly here.  Great ambiance, clean & modern interior, and fast service.
author: Christina G.

description:
Convenient location, but it's hard to get a spot any day of the week.

Also, the lighting is kind of poor for reading in most of the store in the evenings.
author: Anthony W.

description:
ATMOSPHERE:
Yay this one has booth seating ... and good number of outlets within the store. The rest is not bad, not the biggest, has bar seating facing out the window to watch the street and nice tall tables. It's right on Irving and 19th, pretty centralized part of Inner Sunset. Gotta love how Starbucks switched to free unlimited wifi.
author: Angela L.

description:
Unbeatable customer service! 

I studied here from 5:30 am to 11, and asked for numerous water refills and other annoying requests, and the staff was unwaveringly friendly every time.

Sarah was a complete sweetheart, polite to every guest she interacted with, and the Assistant Manager, Kris (sp?) was incredibly accommodating, and even offered me a banana bread that had been heated up my mistake.

I have always thought highly of this location, but seeing their great interactions with guests during the busy rushes over a period of hours really showcased how concerned this staff is with customer service.

You guys run a well-oiled machine! Thank you for making my morning!!

Alyssa
author: Alyssa A.

description:
The one thing I love about starbucks is that they have a high standard for making sure wherever you are in the world, the moment you walk into starbucks you will feel like you're in your own neighborhood. Standard: clean, people are cordial, and make an effort to know your name. 

The only thing I'm not too crazy about is that there are some crazy people who just chill here. Definitely distracting when I'm trying to read or study.
author: Wanster L.

description: Emily is the best barista I've ever had in my entire coffee drinking career. Not only was she super helpful, she made my whole freaking day with her enthusiasm about coffee and life in general. I walked in despondent and left in a cheerful mood with a delicious beverage that she recommended. Not even sure what was in my cup, BUT I LIKED IT. Best Starbucks ever.
author: Deborah R.

description:
This Starbucks is always busy. Yet the staff there is always friendly and helpful. 

I just tried one of the new cake pops. It is basically a lolly pop made of cake. A nice idea and a unique departure from the cup cake. 

I tried the "tiramisu" it was very good, the texture reminded me of marzipan. 

Today I tried the new red velvet mini whoopie pie. It is very tasty and the staff places it in a little box for take out. So cute! 

While both items mentioned are good and worth a try, at over a $1.60 a piece there are other things on the menu I would much rather spend my money on. 

I still think the pumpkin scones and ginger bread are among the best on the menu and worth splurging on once in a while much more so than these new items. Although, as I say, these new items are worth trying, at least once.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Really three stars only because of the tough parking situation.

They just redecorated this place so it's nicer/new looking. The drawback is you can definitely smell the paint and hanging out here too long may give you a headache. Still, the friendly staff, layout and wall-outlets make it worthwhile. Oh, and the new vanilla bean cupcake they have is a must-try!

I'd go more often if the parking was easier to find. Or you can risk life-and-limb and park on the 18th Ave. side of Irving St. and use the crosswalk.
author: Peter L.

description: Starbucks are everywhere but this is the one I come to the most. Besides the coffee, I love the staff here. I got to know them and they give me a very personal experience. Let alone how busy Starbucks is, they take the time to hear about your weekend, stir up that coffee for you, and wishing you a great day. Way to start a morning!
author: Nancy N.

description: Same like any other Starbucks around. I love their frappies :D
author: Amy C.

description: Friend needed hot chocolate after dinner. He did not complain so I guess it was fine.
author: Carrie W.

description: Men in women's bathroom. This is becoming normal to me now in SF.  This is a small, long, Industrial feeling Starbuck's. The dirty bathrooms both in the women's and men's were not good. The coffee was made correctly and the friendly baristas make it a good stop fr a drink or pastry.
author: H D.

description: One of the Starbucks that makes yummy passion tea lemonades.
author: Yolanda L.

description: Tastes like the rest of the Starbucks out there. It was pretty empty when I went on Saturday night so it would be a great place to study. But then again, who wants to study - on a Saturday?
author: Jess W.

description:
Not too great for a Starbucks. I go almost every Saturday because it's really close to my house and they've messed up my order 3 weeks in a row. 

It's very busy on weekend mornings so best to 'order and go'. 

And if you get breakfast food, double check the heat it up properly because I had a couple of items that were cold in the middle and I had to ask them to do it again.
author: Chris D.

description:
My least favorite Starbucks, even 'tho the place is huge with ample seating.

Their coffee is served lukewarm and last week, the guy made it so lukewarm that the annual holiday peppermint mocha I was so looking forward to drinking still had unmelted clumps of chocolate on the bottom. 
It's almost as bad as when I make lumpy gravy.  How can you mess up a nice cup of coffee that costs me over $3?  I should've taken it back and demanded another.  I guess the best thing is to stay away from this Starbucks.  I had a disapponting lukewarm cup of coffee a few months ago from this place too.  Must be saving on the heat because of the economy.
author: Ry T.

description: What I love about this Starbucks are the staff.  I come here almost every morning and the staff are always great and professional.  Four stars in general but Lanette made it a 5 star experience.  She is super nice, friendly and smiles every time.  With that kind of customer service, she should seriously be considered for the manager position.  Ok, now to the not so good.  Parking is generally awful in the evenings or weekends but we're reviewing Starbucks, not Starbucks parking.  Next, the lines can be sometimes pretty long and slow, but it is slow because of the customers and not the staff.  These annoying customers (and you know who are you) always order not just 1 drink but 4 to 5 frapps (seriously, I thought we're still recovering from a recession) some bagels, pastries, CD's, croissants that need to be heated and THEN they slowly dig into the little purse of theirs and have 7 different gift cards to use and then for some inexplicable reason, also wants to reload that gift card.  WHAT??  What is suppose to be a simple order of coffee or latte now turns into a 5 minute transaction. Most of the time, they will open up another line, but sometimes they don't.  My only suggestion to the staff is that maybe if you do see a long line, drop what you're doing, i.e., cleaning equipments or loading supplies and clear the line and wait till it is quiet before returning to your other task.  But nevertheless, the staff are awesome.
author: Hairy Potmaker C.

description:
Pros: Close to my place. Warm. Relatively clean. Usually an open table. If not, usually someone is nice enough to shift their stuff and share. Baristas are very good about standing up to/ regulating on people who overstay their welcome, are being disruptive, etc. Good service. 

Cons: Drip coffee is of inconsistent quality. High concentration of creepers who like to stare in an unsettling manner. 

I think this starbucks is about as good as it can get for a location that's so near a major busline/ the park. But I find it to be a little too stressful to get much quality work done.
author: Rika Y.

description:
As far as Starbucks goes this is one of my favorites. I live walking distance from this one and I'm in here all the time. The thing that I love the best about this place is the barristas, they are all very personable and remember not only what my "regular" is but my morning and my evening "regular". How awesome is that!? 

Keep up the good work guys!
author: Siannan G.

description:
This morning I had the distinct pleasure of not only waiting 10 minutes for my soy latte, but also witnessing the barista, a tragic hipster with black or blonde or blueish hair and horn-rimmed glasses, yell at a customer.

Said customer was a sweet-looking elderly gentleman with a crooked smile who was concerned that his drink be made to his specifications -- extra foam.  And why shouldn't he get exactly what he paid for?  After all, a latte there costs half his medicare check.

At his request for more foam as Hipster barista was making it, she basically yelled in his face, "I HEARD YOU.  EXTRA FOAM."

Now, I don't expect that working at a Starbucks during morning rush is a trip to Pleasure Island, however, I do expect that the elderly, who tend to be particular and occasionally annoyingly particular, are treated with the respect that they deserve.

I was actually appalled by this blatantly disrespectful transaction and am contemplating talking to the manager there.

But I'm sure hipster barista will see this and smoke a pack of Parliaments and slam dance accordingly.

P.S. -- My latte was cold and tasted like they burnt the milk.

Thanks!
author: Rachel G.

description:
Must've been an off day...My passion iced tea and my bf's cinnamon dolce latte were lacking a bit of sugar. The baristas were friendly, even made small talk and asked me if I was Vietnamese after reading my name off my card. Drinks were made quickly, which leave me to think they must have skipped the sugar portion of the drinks. I should've brought it back, but we were in a hurry to leave. 

The layout of this starbucks is a lot bigger than any I have been to, +1 star.
author: Ashley B.

description:
Decent Starbucks size- and service-wise, but oh, the wi-fi...slow as molasses, reminiscent of dial-up..or maybe worse.

Came in here today looking for a place to work/escape the roommates.  This Starbucks and the one on West Portal are closest to me, and since that one is crowded and cramped, opted for this one, which has tables and chairs that aren't entirely on top of each other (though they're not always clean).  The space factor, lighting that's not overly bright, and fairly friendly staff are what this location has going for it.

But heaven help you if you need the Internet.  Maybe something's just going on today, but websites take at least 5 minutes each to load, if they load at all.

I may go again to see if today was just a fluke, but otherwise, this is best as a grab-and-go spot for your caffeine fix, not for staying to study.
author: Dee K.

description: I don't drink coffee. If I buy something at Starbucks, I usually pick up some sweets from the counter, like a scone or Madelines. I had to use the restroom when I came in this past Tuesday. The cashier was nice with a smile. The bathroom was clean.
author: Kekumukula N.

description: Fan of the coffee.... only complaint is that the women's bathroom was out of service, so i had to use the men's. It just smelled like pee in there and didn't look like they had cleaned it.
author: Irma R.

description:
I like this place.  Just not the ppl that sit around here all day.

I like to come here with a friend to have a cup of coffee and to sit and chat for a while. 

While EVERYONE ELSE has one table all to themself, with their laptops plugged into the wall outlet.  As we talk, they look up at us like we're being TOO loud for them to concentrate on whatever the eff is on their comp.  This isnt the library!  Dont drink your ONE cup of coffee and stay there the whole damn day. UGH.  When we're done with our drinks, we leave.  SO YOU CAN BE AT PEACE WITH YOUR COMP!

how annoying.  Just like the people that read at borders and dont buy the book!
author: kim w.

description:
I'm prepared to get vomited on by Yelp, but here goes:

This Starbucks gets slammed every weekday morning!  I'm very impressed by the staff here, because of their ability to get people's orders, exchange currency, and serve drinks in a very timely manner.
author: Anthony B.

description:
This bux has been my daily morning stop for the past few months due to a project in the area. Parking is fine up until 7AM. Some of the staff are friendly and professional. Most not tho. There is one guy that has been sick for the past few weeks and doesn't seem to get that coughing and sniffling does not make for a good coffee. There is one gal that was thanking me before giving me my change. I don't tip my change when she is there. 

Too bad there isn't a closer bux on my morning route. I miss going to the one on Mariposa.
author: Kevo M.

description:
I love Starbucks, I admit it.  I don't know why San Franciscans hate it so much, but that's irrelevant.  The point is, of all the Starbucks I've been to, this is by far one of the worst.

They have a children's play area for starters.  No, not some tubular maze and such, but a little drawing table and a box of randomness.  

Let me take a step back and describe this properly.  I had a hard time finding a parking spot in the first place.  I had to double park and leave my friend in the car.  I jaunt over to Starbucks with my wonderful hangover from the new year's celebration trying to avoid the glorious sunlight that was shining ahead of me for my drive back down to the peninsula.  

I stumble in this place, hidden behind my sunglasses just wanting my coffee and to run away.  The instant I stepped inside I was semi-taken aback by all the people.  Ok, I can handle that.  I then get in line, and decide I want a grande nonfat no-foam latte with a shot of eggnog.  The snotty cashier informed me, "Oh, we no longer have eggnog.  You'll have to order something else."  I'm completely baffled in my state, and continue on, "It's on your menu?  In three places no less."  "Sir, we haven't gotten our new menus, we'll be changing them on Thursday."  "Well, don't have it as your 'Choice of the Day' if you don't have it." ...

Continuing on, I decide then to order a grande 2 pump sugar-free vanilla, 2 pump sugar-free hazlenut, nonfat, no-foam latte.  She proceeds to write this down after asking me to repeat myself three times.  Then she rang it up, charging me for 2 flavors.  So, not wanting to make a joke of myself, I say, "A grande comes with 4 shots of syrup, yes?"  "Yes," was her reply.  "So, why are you charging me for 8?" "I have to charge you for the two flavors."  I'm thoroughly unimpressed with her attitude, so continue on, "I ordered 4 shots, not 8, so why are you charging me for 8?  I've other baristas charge me only for 4, why are you doing 8?"  "Because I have to ... ."  At that point, I was thoroughly pissed off and tired of arguing with this blonde, so I said, "Whatever.  Charge me, I'm done arguing with you, I don't give a d*** about the 40 cents anymore."  

After having spent a few minutes arguing with her, I picked up my coffee, but was so disgusted with the place that I didn't even drink any of it until late that night after I reheated it.

This place is to be avoided, plain and simple.

*WiFi hotspot (TMobile)
*iTunes WiFi Music Store
author: Brent A.

description: Only a block outside of Golden Gate Park, this is a nice store.  A little busy, but not too loud.
author: Karl S.

description:
Barista: What do you want?
Me: A venti vanilla latte and a tall rasberry mocha please.
Barista: One pump or three.
Me: Um, of the rasberry syrup? I'm not sure, what do you think would be better?
Barista: I only drink black coffee, I don't know (said in a condescending tone while rolling her eyes, giving an impatient sigh and tersely holding the pen poised over the coffee cup).
Me: Oh, um, I don't know. Um, three? I think that would be good? (said while flustered and embarrassed).


One would think that even though that womyn only drank black coffee, she'd have to go through training to find out how many pumps of rasberry syrup would make a drink taste decent.

If you want to experience horrendous customer service, go to this shop and look for the bored hipster looking girl with short black hair.
author: Kimberlee S.

description:
This is a good place to study..or to eat your tacos from Underdog's, haha. Okay, so my friend and I intended to study here after we had dinner at Underdog's, but since it was so crowded over there, we decided to come in here, call in our order, and pick it up when it was ready. Our plan worked out perfectly. 

After we devoured our tacos, we spent a good part of our evening studying here. I went to order drinks for us and the cashier could have been friendlier. My friend wanted a venti soy caramel macchiato, no foam, with whipped cream and LIGHT caramel. Yea, it was a complicated order, but aren't you trained to do this? Fast forward to five minutes later when we watched the barista squeeze a gallon (exaggeration) of caramel syrup on my friend's drink. This could have easily been avoided if she had taken more care to do her job rather than chatting with her friend who was posted at the pick-up counter. He was there for a good 45 minutes, walking back and forth between her and his phone that was charging in the corner. Umm, no, go home so your friend can concentrate on not getting fired. One star for free wi-fi and a place to study, and another star for allowing us to devour our yummy tacos there.
author: Audrey T.

description:
I was glad to see I'm not the only one that thinks this place sucks! I friggin' hate this place! How long does it take to make a mocha? Jesus, I've never waited so long! Average at least 10 minutes no matter what you order...total crap! And every single time I have walked in this place, no matter what time of day, there is a huge line.

They should take a lesson from the spot across from the old Macateer High...they kick ass! They have a real steady flow of customers so they keep the milk warm and ready to go. Awesome.

FYI: There are several local coffee shops in the area, one directly down the block on Irving. Much much better
author: Jocelyn J.

description:
Two stars off because the service is sometimes a hit or miss, and why do they have freaking five to seven workers behind that cramped counter during even their downtime? Oh well, that's not my problem, I guess.

I'm not much of a coffee connoisseur (which is probably made even more obvious by the fact that I'm a Starbucks customer), but from what I can tell, their drinks are pretty much your standard Starbucks fare. What I do appreciate is the location, because it's in my district. 

The location also tells you everything you need to know about its clientle - old Asian couples coming in here with their Sheng Kee baked goods to munch on while sharing a venti drink, high school kids from all over hopping off the 28 to play a game of cards over their fraps and then late at night, all the city's beloved hipsters (and the occasional State student looking to escape) bring their laptops for a nice quiet evening. Because of its pretty steady flow of traffic and ergo, the noise level, it's not the ideal place to come to get any work done during the day (even though I do that anyway), but for a drink with a friend or just by yourself to people watch, it's not bad at all.

Really, it isn't.
author: Betty W.

description:
This place was kinda busy when I went in. No biggie, I'll wait. Finally, my time to order! My barista was this Asian chick with blonde hair (is this the reincarnation of the hipster black/blonde/blueish hair that other reviewers  are talking about?). Anyway, just looks at me. No "hello," no smile. Fine. I don't care. It is about the drink anyway. (I would have liked to go to the other barista who was at the other register because she was greeting her customers with a smile and a cheery "hello," but oh well.) Give her my order (Venti Mocha) and go wait for my drink. The drink comes out a while later (it was somewhat busy, so its ok) and then I leave. 

First sip of my supposedly-fabo drink is BLECH. This tasted like water mixed with a little bit of cocoa powder! I expect a lot better from Starbucks. I overlooked the dirty napkin/straws/condiments station, the no greeting from barista chick, and the long wait to get THIS! 

I have had better from Starbucks stores inside of Safeways! 

No thanks.
author: Rosa Y.

description: They rocked it today. 10 minutes before I had to be to work with a line out the door, they were fast and efficient!  Got out of there in 5 min and got to work with 1 minute to spare...perfect! ;)
author: Jessica G.

description:
GOOD:  plenty of starbucks-colored furniture.  nice to just slump back at a window seat and people watch...

BAD:  dude behind me couldn't help but sit at a 4-seat table by himself and YELL into his cell phone for the entire time i was there.  why is he yelling?  because the starbucks jazzfest MUSIC was turned up high enough, thus forcing everyone in the store to raise their own voices.  to make things worse, just the way the interior is built, an unbelievable amount of NOISE echoes off the walls.  i move to the side tables, i move to the corners, doesn't help.  my ipod earbuds are turned up, yet i can still hear most everything in the store... no, im not going to invest $100+ on noise cancellation headsets.

that was my sit-in experience on a friday nite.  the kids "corner" looks like $HIT.  dim lighting, tub of crayons, torn coloring books, tiny plastic chairs and a table that's been assaulted by countless drawings already.  staff doesn't care too much about DIRTY tables neither.  and if u come at the right time, they'll also bust out THE BROOM to sweep.  dude, i dont want to see dust catching hang time around me while im still drinking, or swept up FILTH hitting my bags on the floor.  

oh, and the cashier area smells like pee.

best to just take that order togo.
author: Ethan L.

description: If you're coming here expecting reliable wifi service to study or do work, don't spend your money. Coffee and tea tastes like normal Starbucks, but I came 3 different times, spent good money, and once I logged on the internet was PAINFULLY slow. Now I frequent a cafe up the street and use their password protected wifi and good coffee.
author: Mona Z.

description:
They have lots of seating; which is a plus....even though the spot light made me feel like I was being abducted...by imperialist light-skinned aliens.

A girl spilled a whole cup of coffee (she takes cream).  The guy with her gets the napkins while I ask the one of the Baristas for a mop.  They come out really quickly.  Here's what made me want to tip again:

 - two baristas came out: one with a new cup of coffee for the clumsy girl; 
   and another with the mop
 - after the girl with the mop finishes mopping, she proceeds to get 
    indigenous and starts polishing the floor with some sanitized 
    rags...cuz you know tis the only right way to mop, preventing post-spill 
    sticky filmage that eventually gets sopped up by the feet stammering
    by.

I really wanted to tip again; but I didn't want to break my twenty...my bad...just bein real.

What I ordered: Venti Earl Grey (two bags) with steamed soy.  The nice smiles earns some well deserved stars.  Scored 100 on last inspection.
author: Jay M.

description:
Workers there are sometimes friendly, but it's annoying that MY starbucks always has the topper that sticks in the top of your lid so it doesn't spill..BUT this one doesn't....I wasn't that bothered, but when the barrista said they will bring some out and they never did...i had to yelp. 
Two stars because my drink was tasted fine.
author: M R.

description: Its a spot to meet up with clients, but the place is usually busy and the traffic outside keeps the place kinda noisy. They are friendly and quick though. Got a good green tea frappe today.
author: Brian T.

description:
I like them.  Open earlier than any other local coffee shop like Alvins, and if you need coffee really early in the AM.. THIS IS IT!

After 7am?  You are screwed with zero parking, whack traffic, and possibly a pedestrian death.  Be careful and avoid.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
I know,  Starbucks is an evil empire and all that, but they give me something no place else has been able to: iced coffee that is reliably strong but not horrifically bitter. I have tried so many other places and for the most part they just do not have the iced coffee available and apparently are unable to make it - pouring hot coffee over ice is not going to do it people, you just end up with a watery mess. 

Some days I am out and just need a good refreshing iced coffee and, sadly, Starbucks has been the only place I can rely on. I'd be happy to drop them in favor of smaller local Mom & Pop type places, so if you know of any with truly good iced coffee please do PM me with the suggestion.

*I put my review under this location since it's in my part of town and I have been known to frequent it, however my review is really meant for all Starbucks since my quest for coffee on the rocks when out and about has taken me to many of them.
author: GIR ..

description:
Nice atmosphere in here. Empty tables are rare to come by in the afternoons. Every once in a while, you'll see a bum walk in just to sit. One came up to me and just talked nonstop. Couldn't get any work done that day so I left early.

Can't say much about the coffee. Starbucks is Starbucks wherever they appear. Just wish that they would make my drink hotter. I seem to always have unmelted chocolate at the bottom of mocha.

Cashiers are friendly. Baristas could speed it up a bit. Sometimes, I'm the only one who has placed an order and they still manage to take forever. They just chat with their coworkers while I'm standing there waiting for 5 minutes.
author: Ricardo L.

description:
This Starbucks is one block from where I live, but I rarely go there.  Last week I had a little time before work and I had a Starbucks gift card leftover from Christmas, so I decided to stop in.  I was standing in line waiting to order, when I was suddenly seduced by the sight of RED VELVET cupcakes in the pastry case.  Red velvet cupcakes???  How could I pass them up?  So I got three red velvet cupcakes (one for me and two of my co-workers) and one vanilla cupcake (cheaper if you buy four, so why not?).  The red velvet cupcakes were a huge disappointment!  They weren't even cocoa flavored!!  The frosting was good, though.  Maybe I shouldn't have had my hopes up too high since they were, after all, from STARBUCKS.  Much to my surprise, the vanilla cupcake was REALLY good!  Moist with good frosting.  So, if you're ever in Starbucks and see the pretty red velvet cupcakes, don't be fooled!  Just get the vanilla one.  I promise you, you'll be much happier  :)

My vanilla latte was o.k.
author: Eileen H.

description:
**pastries only**
