i dont give a shit about starbucks and their coffee...but their pastries are soooo good!!!!  i dont drink coffee cuz it stains my teeth, its gets me all jittery and plus, most of their drinks are ridiculously overpriced. but their pastries!!! omg, did i mention they were very yummy?! the pastries are also  overpriced. but when you have a giftcard, it feels like you're getting it for freeeeee dollars!!  

i love their lemon tart! its delicious! i also enjoyed their blueberry muffin. lucky for me i work close by. i can just walk here if i'm ever craving their pastries.

not a fan of starbucks, but a big fan of their pastries.
author: B B.

description:
This poor Starbucks gets a lot of bad press. Unfairly - I have to say. I stop here for coffee every morning at 6:55 and have nothing but good things to say about it..
The workers are all nice and all but one are friendly.(The nice but unfriendly girl isnt on the register any more lately, guess she cant be even fake friendly).
At less than $2 for a giant cup of regular coffee served by friendly folks - compared to Phil'z overpriced coffee ($3. 25 for a "large") served by mildly interested hipsters.
author: Aaaaa B.

description: very spacious and lots of outlets for all you laptop-ers. the seats by the window are great for people watching(you know you like to do it!) restrooms are clean, no complaints here.
author: Melissa Y.

description: I will say for those making the daily morning trek southbound across the great expanse of Highway 1, from Golden Gate Park to the great city of Daly City, this is a decent caffeinated rest stop.  In the AM, it's easy to find parking, and you're on your way fairly quickly.  Otherwise, this location is kind of cramped.  Plus there are a lot of other decent places to get your sweet beverages from only a block or two from here.  But hey, for those of you who resist change, embrace globalization, or simply want a cup of fast food coffee on the way to work, this Starbucks may be the place for you.
author: Tony L.

description: I love the guys who work at this Starbucks. They're so good at what they do that within 3 seconds they coerced me into getting a grande when I walked in wanting a tall. The guy with the long hair who makes the espresso drinks is so funny. I'm the kind of person who loves chatting it up with random people, so that's why I like seeing him behind the counter. But what's good is that he is able to read people. If you come in here and your energy is all business, he's not gonna bother you. Good guys. Good coffee. A+.
author: Becky U.

description: From Jeffs Jeans to Starbucks, a nice place to yelp down a mocha frap.
author: Tina L.

description:
I went there today. I don't know if they have rookies there, but it seemed like it today. My friend and I were there and they didn't have the cups ready to just take orders and write on them what you wanted and or they were missing a 3rd person. But then when I think about it, there was 3 people. The guy making the drinks was clueless and the guy at the register was clueless. OK, he charged the right amount, but he couldn't write the drink on the cup. There wasn't much of a wait for the order to be placed, but one for waiting to pick up.

I guess I'm just used to the place that I go to each morning where they know me and have my order down to a science. There is free Wi-Fi if you have a Starbucks gift card and register it online. You'd get two hours of free Wi-Fi. If you don't you do have to pay so really you have to pay if you're not a Starbucks member and if you exceed the two hours.

I don't know if I'd go back, but they need a better design. The drink making area is small.
author: Jen C.

description: It tends to be pretty busy but if you can get a seat its a decent starbucks. I had a cheese bagel with cream cheese. It was pretty good though I had to spread the cream cheese on it myself.  The restroom has a lock code on it that's hard to remember. I'm not sure about power outlets but the seating layout seems to be a good for both folks chatting and studying. Parking sucks. Sorry barrista if I stared at your nose ring. I tried not to but I was just curious about it. Its like with women with cleavage, I'm not turned on, nor horny, and I try not too look, its just a natural phenomena for the eyes to follow things that follow or lead to a certain symmetry or line. Just innocent looks.
author: Dijon Y.

description: When I need a quick coffee fix or a change in study scenery, I come to this location. The place gets a lot of foot traffic and the door never stays closed for more than 7 minutes (on an average) with it being in front of a bus stop as well as on the corner of 19th Ave. They have a kids table but that's about it...well, a table and maybe one crayon (if you're lucky). Occasionally I'll see a homeless guy sit on one of the chairs for a few hours. Coffee tastes like Starbucks.
author: Janel Y.

description: This starbucks has some serious jerks working here. A couple of the folks have been cool, but I have to say I've had more bad experiences than good ones here. And....they burned my drink. Maybe I just have had bad timing?
author: Zoeboe D.

description: In a city of great independent coffee shops why do we need Starbucks? Well, in this neighborhood there is not a lot of good coffee and almost no good places to sit down. The Third Place, ie Home, Work... and Starbucks, is necessary for a healthy community. Where else can you overhear your neighbors conversations or spy on what websites they're perusing.  And godbless those venti mocha frappucinnos! A trifecta of excess.
author: Phil M.

description:
this place is so close to my house. i don't see a point coming here. the one on irving and 7th is better then this place. most people who have cars woudln't mind going down there. parking is a little better since it's not int he intersection of the damn 19th ave. 

the place inside is moderate. nothign special. bunch of seats. the drinks are alright, the workers re a pain int he ass. the internet is not free. DAMN why can't a high end coffee shop like this provide free wifi
author: Eric Y.

description:
sub-par drinks.
you pay for internet.
limited seating.
rude baristas.
no plugs for laptops.
really, really loud music.
lots of homeless people.  who i normally don't have a problem with, but when they make work impossible, i have a problem.

i am never going here again.
author: annabel l.

description: This is a great place to come and enjoy the paper and have a nice cup of Joe. The people behind the counter are friendly, the coffee is always fresh. It is my fav Starbucks to come to in sf. There are a few homeless people but hey they need their coffee fix to. It is a great people watching place, specially being near a bus stop. It is amazing how many rude and demanding customers this place gets. some of them I personally like to B... smack.
author: mike J.

description: i just got back from buying a carmel macchiato at this starbucks and i asked for extra carmel.  when i ask for extra carmel i mean a squirt more, not half the bottle like i got.  i thought it was just a one time error but then i saw two other people complain in the ten minutes i was there.  one woman said her drink was too sweet and she was trying to dilute her coffee and another woman said her hot chocolate tasted like coffee.  i'll give them one more chance- could be an off day.
author: A L.
